tasks.title: Add configuration encryption at rest for sensitive profiles
tasks.description:
Implement encryption at rest for configuration files containing credentials. Currently config.json stores API tokens and passwords in plaintext. This is a security risk for shared systems or backup exposure.

Encryption features:
- AES-256-GCM encryption of sensitive fields
- Argon2id key derivation from user password
- Keyring integration for passwordless operation (store encryption key in OS keychain)
- Automatic encryption detection and migration
- CLI commands for encrypt/decrypt/rotate-key

Fields encrypted:
- api_token
- password
- session tokens

Implementation uses ring or aes-gcm crates. Master key can be:
1. Derived from user-provided password
2. Random key stored in OS keyring (default)
3. Environment variable for CI/CD

Critical for enterprise security requirements.
evidence: Config stored as plaintext JSON (crates/config/src/persistence/profiles.rs)
API tokens and passwords visible in config.json
No encryption at rest - backups and file permissions are only protection
Keyring integration exists but only as opt-in, not default
No encrypted config format or migration path
plan: Add aes-gcm and argon2 to workspace dependencies
Create encryption.rs module with encrypt/decrypt functions
Define EncryptedProfile format with ciphertext and salt
Implement key derivation from password or keyring
Add --encrypt flag to config init command
Add config encrypt/decrypt/rotate-key commands
Create automatic migration from plaintext to encrypted
Write tests for encryption roundtrip and key rotation
Verify by running: splunk-cli config encrypt and seeing encrypted config.json

tasks.title: Add graceful degradation for partial multi-instance failures
tasks.description:
Implement graceful degradation when some instances in multi-instance dashboard fail. Currently multi-instance operations are all-or-nothing - one failure can prevent viewing data from healthy instances.

Features:
- Per-instance error tracking
- Partial results display with visual indicators
- Cached fallback for failed instances
- Automatic retry with exponential backoff
- 'Last successful' timestamp per instance

Visual indicators:
- Green: Instance healthy, data fresh
- Yellow: Instance failed, showing cached data
- Red: Instance failed, no cached data available

Benefits:
- Better UX during partial outages
- Continue monitoring healthy instances despite failures
- Clear visibility into which instances have issues
- Reduced alert fatigue from transient failures
evidence: Multi-instance dashboard fetches all instances - one failure affects all (crates/tui/src/runtime/side_effects/multi_instance.rs)
No per-instance error isolation
No cached data fallback for failed instances
No visual indication of partial vs complete data
plan: Refactor multi_instance fetch to use join_all with individual error handling
Add InstanceResult enum with Data, Cached, Failed variants
Implement per-instance caching with TTL
Add visual indicators in multi_instance screen for instance health
Add 'last successful fetch' timestamp display
Add retry button for individual failed instances
Write tests for partial failure scenarios
Verify by configuring 3 instances, taking one down, and seeing 2 healthy + 1 cached/failed

tasks.title: Add transaction support for multi-step configuration changes
tasks.description:
Implement transaction support for atomic multi-step configuration operations. Currently multi-step operations lack atomicity - partial failures can leave system in inconsistent state.

Transaction features:
- Begin/commit/rollback for configuration changes
- Savepoint support for nested operations
- Automatic rollback on error
- Preview/dry-run mode showing planned changes
- Transaction log for audit trail

Use cases:
- Create index + setup inputs + configure forwarding (all succeed or all rollback)
- Modify multiple saved searches atomically
- Bulk user/role changes with consistency

Implementation uses two-phase commit pattern:
1. Phase 1: Validate all operations, acquire locks
2. Phase 2: Execute operations, commit or rollback

Benefits: Data consistency, auditability, safer bulk operations.
evidence: No transaction support in client or CLI - operations are individual API calls
Multi-step config changes can fail partially leaving inconsistent state
No rollback mechanism for failed operations
No preview/dry-run for complex multi-resource changes
plan: Create transaction.rs with Transaction and TransactionManager structs
Define TransactionOperation trait for reversible operations
Implement two-phase commit with validation and execution phases
Add transaction begin/commit/rollback to client
Add --transaction flag to CLI for batch operations
Add transaction log persistence for audit trail
Write tests for transaction commit and rollback scenarios
Verify by running: splunk-cli --transaction index create ... input create ... commit

tasks.title: Add colorblind-friendly and high-contrast TUI themes
tasks.description:
Implement accessibility-focused themes for users with visual impairments. Current themes may not be accessible to users with color vision deficiencies.

New themes:
- High Contrast: Pure black/white with clear borders, WCAG AAA compliant
- Deuteranopia-friendly: Blue/yellow palette (red-green safe)
- Protanopia-friendly: Blue/orange palette (red-green safe)
- Tritanopia-friendly: Red/teal palette (blue-yellow safe)
- Monochrome: Patterns and intensity instead of color

Features:
- Theme preview in settings
- Automatic detection from terminal capabilities
- Custom color overrides per user
- Pattern/texture indicators (not just color)

Implementation adds new theme variants to existing theme system in crates/tui/src/ui/theme.rs.

Critical for inclusive design and accessibility compliance.
evidence: Current themes use color without pattern/texture alternatives
No high-contrast theme option
No colorblind-friendly palettes
No accessibility settings in theme configuration
WCAG guidelines recommend not relying solely on color for information
plan: Add HighContrast theme variant with WCAG AAA colors
Add Deuteranopia and Protanopia-friendly palettes
Add Monochrome theme using patterns and intensity
Add pattern indicators for critical states (not just color)
Add theme preview widget showing all semantic colors
Add --theme-accessibility flag for CLI output
Write accessibility documentation in docs/accessibility.md
Verify by running: splunk-tui, open Settings, cycle themes and checking contrast ratios
